meanings.sent1: The obstreperous children were running around the classroom, making it hard for the teacher to focus.
meanings.sent2: The party next door was so obstreperous that I couldn't even hear myself think.
meanings.sent3: The obstreperous puppy kept barking at its own reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled obstreperously through the trees, creating a cacophony of sound.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's obstreperous tantrum echoed through the entire store.

meanings.definition: Resisting control or restraint in a noisy manner.
meanings.sent1: The obstreperous protesters refused to leave the building until their demands were met.
meanings.sent2: The cat became obstreperous when it realized it was time for a bath.
meanings.sent3: The obstreperous alarm clock seemed to enjoy waking up its owner every morning.
meanings.sent4: The storm raged obstreperously, shaking the windows and doors of the house.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's obstreperous behavior at the restaurant caused quite a scene.
